data.text: Advantages: health and well-being, clearer state of mind, lots of others Disadvantages: unconscious or downright aggressive driving on the part of drivers, fumes and airborne tyre particles..nano sized. "L'enfer c'est les automobilistes" JP Sartre - paraphrased.

data.text: you will experience many moods: the trip will start with (I can do it and I will ! ) uphills are uphells you're like (oh God why did I do this ! ) downhills are like (hooorayyy !!! ) rain (it depends on the type of rain you face) sun (it's all fun and games untill it's hot and you find no shadows) (always carry enough water and protein bars) cuz once you're out of water it's pure suffering ! once you finish the trip, it's the edge of glory and it's all you'll talk about for the rest of the year

data.text: Works for me, but you have to want to travel minimalistic. Tent, no cookware. In return, you travel light, Aero and thus climbs are not so bad, distances can be longer.

data.text: It's one of the fastest. I did my first two tours on road bikes. But I was limited to good paved roads, I soon found man dirt roads and trails the road bike couldn't handle. That was 38 years ago. Road bikes were just about the only thing to get, then mountain bikes came along and I started using them to tour on. Now I tour on a fat bike.

data.text: I have a modified Giant Escape 2,road bike. 700cx35mm Ryder Sputnik wheels, Continental Ride Tour tyres. Also a 2 to 10 gear system designed for making hills easier and swept back handlebars. Great touring bike. I use it every day too for work and such like.
data.author: Kevin S Litt

data.text: A quiet campsite
data.author: Jeff Stone

data.text: Cooking dinner after a hard days ride
data.author: Jeff Stone

data.text: My friend and I rode across the U.S. from San Francisco to New York in 1996. I rode a Trek 2300 and my friend rode a Pinarello, both road bikes. Both road bikes had double front chainrings (53/39), so it was important that the cassette have some climbing gears. I think we used a 12-27 cassette.
data.author: Angelo Alvarez

data.text: It's the most unstable when loaded, it's really uncomfortable on uneven surfaces, even tarmac that isn't perfect, it's more sensitive to mechanical damages. But it's fast and easy to get comfortable on.
data.author: Natalie Dimosthenous

data.text: Road bike confines you to paved roads which can be very boring compared to gravel roads/trails. Advantage is you are mostly in populated areas so supplyes are easily availible and mechanical problems easier sorted. Road bike will be rougher on your body compared to touring/gravel bike as position is more agressive and tyres are narrower, but if you are used to the bike and spending alot of time in that position its not a problem.
data.author: Rok Pajer

data.text: Heads Up! This could be really frustrating! I had same experience a while ago! My personal FB got hacked and further disabled! The hacker had manage to change my original email and Alt phone number and got it linked with another. I tried numerous time to recover my account but no single human at the help centre responded to my almost weekly appeal to get back my page! Luckily after almost 4 months locked out I was recommended to #BABBAGE-BOTNETon IG responded and they offered to help and they did. I had almost lost 12years of family memories, photos of the kids when they were babies. If you need help getting back your account, reach out to them via IG #BABBAGE-BOTNET on instagram
data.author: Vic Tor

data.text: Depends how many kgms U want to carry. Over 30? Take trekking bike with strong wheels. If traveling rocky and difficult roads take hardtail MTB. For 15-20 kgms and non rocky paths gravel bike will be very decent choice. Less that 15 kgms and paved roads? Road bike.
data.author: Arkadiusz Wojciechowski
